Clojure - yetanalytics/pathetic: Utility Library for handling JSONPath and navigating JSON structures

2023/07/23
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

The yetanalytics/pathetic library is a utility library for working with JSONPath and navigating JSON structures in Clojure. It provides a set of core functions that make it easy for developers to parse JSONPath strings, extract specific key paths or values from JSON data, and even create a map associating JSON paths to values.

To get started with yetanalytics/pathetic, you can add it to your project's dependencies by including the following line in your deps.edn file:

:deps {yetanalytics/pathetic {:mvn/version "x.y.z"}}

Once you have added the library as a dependency, you can use the core functions provided by the com.yetanalytics.pathetic namespace. These functions accept JSONPath strings and allow you to perform operations like parsing paths, retrieving key paths, getting values, and creating path-value maps.

One of the key features of yetanalytics/pathetic is its support for optional arguments in the form of an opts-map. This allows you to customize the behavior of the functions based on your specific requirements. Some of the supported options include :first? to retrieve only the first result, :strict? to enforce strict matching, :return-missing? to include missing values, and :return-duplicates? to include duplicate values.

In addition to the core functions, yetanalytics/pathetic also provides a set of utility functions in the pathetic.parse namespace. These functions allow you to parse JSONPath strings and convert them into paths that can be used with the core functions. This can be particularly useful in performance-critical situations.

To see examples of how to use yetanalytics/pathetic, you can refer to the library's README file on GitHub. It includes detailed explanations and code snippets that demonstrate the various functions and their usage.

Overall, yetanalytics/pathetic is a powerful utility library for handling JSONPath and navigating JSON structures in Clojure. Its core functions and optional arguments make it flexible and customizable, while its utility functions provide additional convenience. Whether you are working with complex JSON data or simply need to extract specific values, yetanalytics/pathetic can be a valuable tool in your Clojure development workflow.
